metadata.Description: Resilient infrastructure refers to the design and construction of infrastructure systems that can withstand and recover quickly from natural disasters, climate change impacts, and other shocks and stresses.

entities.Description: Resilient infrastructure refers to the design and construction of infrastructure systems that can withstand and recover quickly from natural disasters, climate change impacts, and other shocks and stresses.

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure implements building standards that ensure the infrastructure can withstand and recover from natural disasters and other shocks.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure funds research and development projects that aim to improve the resilience of infrastructure systems.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure focuses on climate change adaptation strategies to ensure infrastructure systems can cope with the impacts of climate change.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure is implemented in urban areas to enhance the resilience of cities and towns.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure partners with the private sector to leverage their expertise and resources in developing and implementing resilient infrastructure projects.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure contributes to the achievement of various Sustainable Development Goals, such as Goal 9: Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure monitors the performance of infrastructure systems to identify vulnerabilities and areas for improvement.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure sets targets based on resilience indicators to measure the effectiveness of resilience-building efforts.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Renewable energy systems are a crucial component of resilient infrastructure. They provide sustainable and clean energy sources that can withstand disruptions and contribute to the overall resilience of the infrastructure.
relations.Subject: renewable energy systems

relations.Description: Smart grid technology is an important sub-element of resilient infrastructure. It enables efficient and reliable energy distribution, improves grid resilience, and allows for better integration of renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: smart grid technology

relations.Description: Disaster-resistant construction is a key aspect of resilient infrastructure. It involves designing and constructing buildings and infrastructure that can withstand natural disasters, such as earthquakes, hurricanes, and floods, reducing the impact of such events on the overall infrastructure.
relations.Subject: disaster-resistant construction

relations.Description: Climate-resilient transportation is an essential sub-element of resilient infrastructure. It focuses on developing transportation systems that can adapt to the impacts of climate change, such as extreme weather events and rising sea levels, ensuring the continuity of transportation services.
relations.Subject: climate-resilient transportation

relations.Description: Resilient water and sanitation systems are critical components of resilient infrastructure. They involve designing and implementing systems that can withstand disruptions, such as water scarcity, floods, and contamination, ensuring the availability of clean water and proper sanitation facilities even during challenging circumstances.
relations.Subject: resilient water and sanitation systems
